content.text:
# Archaeological Museum of Andros

The Archaeological Museum of Andros is a museum in Andros, Greece, established in 1981 following a donation from the Basil and Elisa Goulandris Foundation.
The building was designed by Stamo Papadaki.
The museum collections ranges from the Mycenaean era to the Roman period.
File:1981 wurde das Archäologische Museum von Andros gegründet. 05.jpg|View into the museum.

File:Kotyle late geometric AM Andros 38 090526.jpg|Geometric kotyle, Zagora, 750-690 BC
File:AM Andros 090591.jpg|Room of archaic sculptures
File:Kouros 090571.jpg|Kouros or sacrificer, marble, Parian influence, Palaiopolis, 575-500 BC
File:1981 wurde das Archäologische Museum von Andros gegründet. 15.jpg|Kouros, marble, Zagariani, import from Naxos, 550-540 BC
File:Small terrakota Female figure headdress 5th BC AM Andros 090548.jpg|Female figurine, Kallivari at Gaurio, 5th century BC
File:1981 wurde das Archäologische Museum von Andros gegründet. 22.jpg|Funeral, 1st century BC, the cross was added later
File:1981 wurde das Archäologische Museum von Andros gegründet. 13.jpg|Hermes of Andros, Palaiopolis, first decade AD, Roman copy of a work of Praxiteles school
